intro: Borodinia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth borodinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or coastal areas. The plant has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental due to its delicate appearance. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
